verses.verse: “There are mines for silver and places where gold is refined.
Iron is extracted from the earth, and copper is smelted from ore.
Miners penetrate the darkness; they search to the farthest recesses to discover the ore hidden in gloom and shadow.
They open shafts in uninhabited places, swinging suspended, far away from anyone.
“While grain is coming forth from the earth above, what lies beneath is ravaged by fire.
Its rocks are the enclosure for sapphires, and there is gold contained in its dust.
No bird of prey knows the path there; the eye of a falcon has not seen it.
Proud beasts have not trodden it; no lion has ever passed over it.
“Man begins to assail the granite rock and overturns the mountains at their foundations.
He cuts channels into the rocks, and his eyes behold precious gems.
He explores the sources of the streams and brings hidden riches to light.
But where can wisdom be found? And where is the place of understanding?
“No one knows the way to it, nor is it to be found in the land of the living.
The abyss declares, ‘It is not in me.’ The sea says, ‘I do not have it.’
It cannot be purchased with gold, nor can its price be weighed out in silver.
“It cannot be acquired with the gold of Ophir, nor with precious onyx or sapphire.
Gold or crystal[d] cannot be compared to it, nor can it be exchanged for vessels of gold.
Neither coral nor alabaster deserve to be mentioned; the price of wisdom is beyond pearls.
Topaz from Ethiopia is worthless in comparison to it, nor can it be valued in terms of pure gold.
“Where then is the source of wisdom? Where is intelligence to be found?
“It cannot be seen by the eye of any living creature; it is even concealed from the birds of the air.
Abaddon and the netherworld[f] admit, ‘We have only heard rumors of it.’
“God alone understands the path to wisdom; he alone knows where it can be found.
For he can observe the farthest ends of the earth, and he sees everything under the heavens.
“When God regulated the force of the wind and measured out the waters,
when he imposed a limit for the rain and cleared a path for the thunderbolt,
then he saw wisdom and evaluated it, established it and assessed it completely.
And then he declared to man: ‘The fear of the LORD is wisdom, and to turn from evil is understanding.’ ”
